description: Explains the what and the why. What is the main idea? What is the purpose? Describes the coding process and implementation choices and gives a high level system overview.

name: recreation Anticlassic 0.8 by Tyler Hobbs
description: I recreated this art to explore how a small mistake can turn an orderly pattern into something unexpectedly beautiful. It shows how chaos can still have a natural structure, like rocks shaped by a river. This process highlights the beauty in unpredictability.

name: recreation Soft Landscape 34 0.8 by Tyler Hobbs
description: I created the Soft Landscape to explore how smooth, flowing lines can evoke the calmness of nature. I wanted to capture the gentle curves of hills and valleys, showing how simple techniques can create a serene and natural-looking landscape.

name: Art Variation 1 - Circular Grid
description: This version uses a circular grid with random colors and shapes, creating a unique, unpredictable pattern.

name: Art Variation 2 - Size-based Circles
description: In this version, the circles are bigger in the center and get smaller as they move outward, forming an interesting pattern.

name: Particle-Circle Interaction
description: This experiment features particles moving toward a corner, interacting with and avoiding circles.

name: Flow Field Particle Motion with Circle Grid
description: This experiment features particles influenced by a flow field while moving across a structured grid of circles.
